ai.summary: ACW Circular Walk 07 is a challenging 20 km circular hike in the UK. The route combines rugged upland sections with woodland tracks, offering varied scenery, elevation, and potential boggy ground. This hard-grade circuit is best undertaken by experienced walkers with navigation skills and a good fitness level.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of steep climbs and descents, exposed grassy and rocky ridges, muddy tracks, rocky trods, woodland paths, and occasional field stiles. The surface can be uneven with loose stones; some sections may be boggy after rain. Navigation is important in places due to limited waymarking.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather forecasts and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy, waterproof hiking boots and bring weather-appropriate clothing. Carry a detailed map and compass or a GPS device; do not rely solely on phone signal. Tackle exposed ridges with caution in windy conditions. Inform someone of your planned route and expected finish time. Carry enough water and snacks; be mindful of fatigue on long ascents. In autumn/winter, use headlamp if there is a chance of finishing after dark.
recommended_gear: Warm layers and hat/gloves as needed
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn for best conditions and daylight; can be tackled in winter with proper equipment and shorter daylight.

seo.title: ACW Circular Walk 07 – 20 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover ACW Circular Walk 07, a 20 km challenging circular hike in the UK. Terrain, safety tips, gear list, and best seasons for this rugged circuit.
